package-manager.name: depot
package-manager.title: teTeX TeX distribution
package-manager.description: teTeX is a complete TeX distribution for Unix compatible systems, maintained by Thomas Esser. It is based on Karl Berry's original Web2c distribution and contains LaTeX, pdfTeX, e-TeX, Omega, xdvik, dvipsk, dviljk, dvipdfm, ps2pk, makeindex, texconfig, updmap, and texdoctk.

item.para: Update ghostscript dependency from 8.63 to 9.01
Update libpng dependency from 1.2.29 to 1.4.4
Update mktemp dependency from 1.5 to 1.7
Update perl dependency from 5.8.8 to 5.12.2
Update zlib dependency from 1.2.3 to 1.2.5

Apply patch for CVE-2010-3702 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3702). An uninitialized pointer use flaw was discovered in poppler. An attacker could create a malicious PDF file that, when opened, would cause applications that use poppler (such as Evince) to crash or, potentially, execute arbitrary code.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-3704 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3704). An array index error was found in the way poppler parsed PostScript Type 1 fonts embedded in PDF documents. An attacker could create a malicious PDF file that, when opened, would cause applications that use poppler (such as Evince) to crash or, potentially, execute arbitrary code.
Update ghostscript dependency from 8.57 to 8.63
Update libpng dependency from 1.2.18 to 1.2.29
Update perl dependency from 5.8.6 to 5.8.8
Update t1lib dependency from 5.1.0 to 5.1.2

Apply patch for CVE-2009-0146 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0146). Multiple buffer overflows in the JBIG2 decoder allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file, related to (1) JBIG2SymbolDict::setBitmap and (2) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-0147 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0147). Multiple integer overflows in the JBIG2 decoder allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file, related to (1) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg, (2) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg, and (3) JBIG2Stream::readGenericBitmap.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-0166 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0166). The JBIG2 decoder allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file that triggers a free of uninitialized memory.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-0791 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0791). Multiple integer overflows allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow, possibly related to (1) Decrypt.cxx, (2) FoFiTrueType.cxx, (3) gmem.c, (4) JBIG2Stream.cxx, and (5) PSOutputDev.cxx in xpdf/. NOTE: the JBIG2Stream.cxx vector may overlap CVE-2009-1179.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-4352 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-4352). Array index error in the DCTStream::readProgressiveDataUnit() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to trigger memory corruption and execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-5392 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5392). Integer overflow in the DCTStream::reset() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file, resulting in a heap-based buffer overflow.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-5393 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5393). Heap-based buffer overflow in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a PDF file that contains a crafted CCITTFaxDecode filter.
Update gd dependency from 2.0.33 to 2.0.35
Update ghostscript dependency from 8.54 to 8.57
Update libpng dependency from 1.2.4 to 1.2.18
Update zlib dependency from 1.1.4 to 1.2.3

Apply patch for CVE-2007-0650 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-0650). Buffer overflow in the open_sty() function in mkind.c for makeindex in teTeX might allow user-assisted remote attackers to overwrite files and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long filename.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-3387 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-3387). Integer overflow in the StreamPredictor::StreamPredictor() function might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file that triggers a stack-based buffer overflow in the StreamPredictor::getNextLine() function.
Update ghostscript dependency from 7.07 to 8.54

Apply patch for CVE-2007-0104 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-0104). The Adobe PDF specification 1.3 allows remote attackers to have an unknown impact, possibly including denial of service (infinite loop), arbitrary code execution, or memory corruption, via a PDF file with a (1) crafted catalog dictionary or (2) a crafted Pages attribute that references an invalid page tree node.
Fix another wrong patch to libs/xpdf/xpdf/Stream.cc as part of CVE-2005-3193.patch using an incorrect number of parameters to error() call
Missed patch to libs/xpdf/xpdf/Decrypt.cc for CVE-2005-0064.patch
Backport some upstream integer overflow fixes from xpdf
Fix off-by-one error leading to possible overwrite of a variable and subsequent SEGV

Apply patch for CVE-2005-3193 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-3193). A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability allows an attacker to construct a carefully crafted PDF file that could cause Xpdf to crash (denial-of-service) or possibly execute arbitrary code when opened.

Apply patch for CVE-2006-0301 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-0301). A heap-based buffer overflow in Splash.cc allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service and possibly execute arbitrary code via specially-crafted splash images that produce certain values that exceed the width or height of the associated bitmap.
Import further fixes to CVE-2004-0888 from Fedora (bug #135393)
Further fixes for CAN-2004-0888 to fix integer overflows
Fix bug in kpathsea library remove_dots() function resolving ".." in pathnames

package-manager.name: inst
package-manager.title: teTeX TeX distribution
package-manager.description: teTeX is a complete TeX distribution for Unix compatible systems, maintained by Thomas Esser. It is based on Karl Berry's original Web2c distribution and contains LaTeX, pdfTeX, e-TeX, Omega, xdvik, dvipsk, dviljk, dvipdfm, ps2pk, makeindex, texconfig, updmap, and texdoctk.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-5393 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5393). Heap-based buffer overflow in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a PDF file that contains a crafted CCITTFaxDecode filter.

Update ghostscript dependency from 8.54 to 8.57
Update libpng dependency from 1.2.4 to 1.2.18
Update zlib dependency from 1.1.4 to 1.2.3

package-manager.name: lpp
package-manager.title: teTeX TeX distribution
package-manager.description: teTeX is a complete TeX distribution for Unix compatible systems, maintained by Thomas Esser. It is based on Karl Berry's original Web2c distribution and contains LaTeX, pdfTeX, e-TeX, Omega, xdvik, dvipsk, dviljk, dvipdfm, ps2pk, makeindex, texconfig, updmap, and texdoctk.

package-manager.name: pkgadd
package-manager.title: teTeX TeX distribution
package-manager.description: teTeX is a complete TeX distribution for Unix compatible systems, maintained by Thomas Esser. It is based on Karl Berry's original Web2c distribution and contains LaTeX, pdfTeX, e-TeX, Omega, xdvik, dvipsk, dviljk, dvipdfm, ps2pk, makeindex, texconfig, updmap, and texdoctk.

package-manager.name: rpm4

It is based on Karl Berry's original Web2c distribution and contains LaTeX, pdfTeX, e-TeX, Omega, xdvik, dvipsk, dviljk, dvipdfm, ps2pk, makeindex, texconfig, updmap, and texdoctk.

Multiple buffer overflows in the JBIG2 decoder allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file, related to (1) JBIG2SymbolDict::setBitmap and (2) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-0147 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0147). Multiple integer overflows in the JBIG2 decoder allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file, related to (1) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg, (2) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg, and (3) JBIG2Stream::readGenericBitmap.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-0166 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0166). The JBIG2 decoder allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file that triggers a free of uninitialized memory.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-0791 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0791). Multiple integer overflows allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow, possibly related to (1) Decrypt.cxx, (2) FoFiTrueType.cxx, (3) gmem.c, (4) JBIG2Stream.cxx, and (5) PSOutputDev.cxx in xpdf/. NOTE: the JBIG2Stream.cxx vector may overlap CVE-2009-1179.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-4352 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-4352). Array index error in the DCTStream::readProgressiveDataUnit() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to trigger memory corruption and execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-5392 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5392). Integer overflow in the DCTStream::reset() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file, resulting in a heap-based buffer overflow.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-5393 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5393). Heap-based buffer overflow in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a PDF file that contains a crafted CCITTFaxDecode filter.
Update gd dependency from 2.0.33 to 2.0.35
Update ghostscript dependency from 8.54 to 8.57
Update libpng dependency from 1.2.4 to 1.2.18
Update zlib dependency from 1.1.4 to 1.2.3

Apply patch for CVE-2007-0650 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-0650). Buffer overflow in the open_sty() function in mkind.c for makeindex in teTeX might allow user-assisted remote attackers to overwrite files and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long filename.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-3387 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-3387). Integer overflow in the StreamPredictor::StreamPredictor() function might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file that triggers a stack-based buffer overflow in the StreamPredictor::getNextLine() function.
Update ghostscript dependency from 7.07 to 8.54

Apply patch for CVE-2007-0104 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-0104). The Adobe PDF specification 1.3 allows remote attackers to have an unknown impact, possibly including denial of service (infinite loop), arbitrary code execution, or memory corruption, via a PDF file with a (1) crafted catalog dictionary or (2) a crafted Pages attribute that references an invalid page tree node.
Fix another wrong patch to libs/xpdf/xpdf/Stream.cc as part of CVE-2005-3193.patch using an incorrect number of parameters to error() call
Missed patch to libs/xpdf/xpdf/Decrypt.cc for CVE-2005-0064.patch
Backport some upstream integer overflow fixes from xpdf
Fix off-by-one error leading to possible overwrite of a variable and subsequent SEGV

Apply patch for CVE-2005-3193 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-3193). A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability allows an attacker to construct a carefully crafted PDF file that could cause Xpdf to crash (denial-of-service) or possibly execute arbitrary code when opened.

Apply patch for CVE-2006-0301 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-0301). A heap-based buffer overflow in Splash.cc allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service and possibly execute arbitrary code via specially-crafted splash images that produce certain values that exceed the width or height of the associated bitmap.
Import further fixes to CVE-2004-0888 from Fedora (bug #135393)
Further fixes for CAN-2004-0888 to fix integer overflows
Fix bug in kpathsea library remove_dots() function resolving ".." in pathnames

package-manager.name: setld
package-manager.title: teTeX TeX distribution
package-manager.description: teTeX is a complete TeX distribution for Unix compatible systems, maintained by Thomas Esser. It is based on Karl Berry's original Web2c distribution and contains LaTeX, pdfTeX, e-TeX, Omega, xdvik, dvipsk, dviljk, dvipdfm, ps2pk, makeindex, texconfig, updmap, and texdoctk.

item.para: Update ghostscript dependency from 8.63 to 9.01
Update libpng dependency from 1.2.29 to 1.4.4
Update mktemp dependency from 1.5 to 1.7
Update perl dependency from 5.8.8 to 5.12.2
Update zlib dependency from 1.2.3 to 1.2.5

Apply patch for CVE-2010-3702 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3702). An uninitialized pointer use flaw was discovered in poppler. An attacker could create a malicious PDF file that, when opened, would cause applications that use poppler (such as Evince) to crash or, potentially, execute arbitrary code.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-3704 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3704). An array index error was found in the way poppler parsed PostScript Type 1 fonts embedded in PDF documents. An attacker could create a malicious PDF file that, when opened, would cause applications that use poppler (such as Evince) to crash or, potentially, execute arbitrary code.
Update ghostscript dependency from 8.57 to 8.63
Update libpng dependency from 1.2.18 to 1.2.29
Update perl dependency from 5.8.6 to 5.8.8
Update t1lib dependency from 5.1.0 to 5.1.2

NOTE: the JBIG2Stream.cxx vector may overlap CVE-2009-1179.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-4352 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-4352). Array index error in the DCTStream::readProgressiveDataUnit() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to trigger memory corruption and execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-5392 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5392). Integer overflow in the DCTStream::reset() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file, resulting in a heap-based buffer overflow.

Apply patch for CVE-2007-5393 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5393). Heap-based buffer overflow in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() method in xpdf/Stream.cc allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a PDF file that contains a crafted CCITTFaxDecode filter.
